meanings.definition: The basic unit of currency in Vanuatu.
meanings.sent1: In Vanuatu, you can use vatu to buy fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for vatu at the local bank.
meanings.sent3: The vatu in my pocket jingled as I walked down the street.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a handful of vatu.
meanings.sent5: The colorful vatu bills fluttered in the breeze like autumn leaves.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 100 grams.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for half a vatu of flour.
meanings.sent2: She weighed the fruit using a vatu scale.
meanings.sent3: The vatu of sugar was so heavy, it almost broke the scale!
meanings.sent4: His love for her was as heavy as a vatu of gold.
meanings.sent5: The vatu of meat was perfectly portioned for the stew.

meanings.sent1: The hikers collected pieces of vatu as souvenirs.
meanings.sent2: The vatu formations on the island were breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: She tripped over a vatu and almost fell into the lava pit!
meanings.sent4: The vatu cliffs stood tall against the fiery sky.
meanings.sent5: The vatu rocks shimmered in the sunlight like precious gems.
